meanings.definition: Known without a doubt; certain; sure.
examples: The bag in her hand is definite proof that she stole your lunch.
I'd like to say a word about that.

meanings.definition: To make feel uncomfortable because of shame or receiving too much attention from others.
examples: I was embarrassed when I realized I forgot to do today's homework.

images.description: Drawing of an emoticon with wide open eyes, red cheeks, and a slightly frowning mouth.
images.caption: Blushing, or having your cheeks turn red, can be a sign that you are embarrassed.

meanings.definition: Remarks or observations, often critical, made across a group of people
examples: She was upset when she heard somebody make a mean comment about her friend.

images.alt: Photo of person holding a smartphone
images.description: Person holding a smartphone. Text comments can be seen on the phone's screen.
images.caption: Texting is one way to make comments.

meanings.definition: To force into an action by strong influence or urging.
examples: My friend pressured me to try out for the soccer team.
